channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Spatio-Temporal Graph Mixformer for Traffic Forecasting
item.description: Additionally, we train an estimator model that express the contribution of a node over the desired prediction.

item.title: Training and Predicting Visual Error for Real-Time Applications
item.description: Specifically, we train and deploy a neural network to estimate the visual error resulting from reusing shading or using reduced shading rates.

item.title: Does Graph Distillation See Like Vision Dataset Counterpart?
item.description: We validate the proposed SGDD across 9 datasets and achieve state-of-the-art results on all of them: for example, on the YelpChi dataset, our approach maintains 98. 6% test accuracy of training on the original graph dataset with 1, 000 times saving on the scale of the graph.

item.title: Wasm-iCARE: a portable and privacy-preserving web module to build, validate, and apply absolute risk models
item.description: Objective: Absolute risk models estimate an individual's future disease risk over a specified time interval.

item.title: Regularization-Based Methods for Ordinal Quantification
item.description: Quantification, i. e., the task of training predictors of the class prevalence values in sets of unlabeled data items, has received increased attention in recent years.

item.title: Overcoming Recency Bias of Normalization Statistics in Continual Learning: Balance and Adaptation
item.description: Continual learning entails learning a sequence of tasks and balancing their knowledge appropriately.

item.title: Variational autoencoder with weighted samples for high-dimensional non-parametric adaptive importance sampling
item.description: In this contribution, we suggest to use as the approximating model a distribution parameterised by a variational autoencoder.

item.title: Extending Multi-modal Contrastive Representations
item.description: Inspired by recent C-MCR, this paper proposes Extending Multimodal Contrastive Representation (Ex-MCR), a training-efficient and paired-data-free method to flexibly learn unified contrastive representation space for more than three modalities by integrating the knowledge of existing MCR spaces.

item.title: SIDE: Self-supervised Intermediate Domain Exploration for Source-free Domain Adaptation
item.description: Domain adaptation aims to alleviate the domain shift when transferring the knowledge learned from the source domain to the target domain.

item.title: MM-BigBench: Evaluating Multimodal Models on Multimodal Content Comprehension Tasks
item.description: Consequently, our work complements research on the performance of MLLMs in multimodal comprehension tasks, achieving a more comprehensive and holistic evaluation of MLLMs.

item.title: Learning To Teach Large Language Models Logical Reasoning
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have gained enormous attention from both academia and industry, due to their exceptional ability in language generation and extremely powerful generalization.

item.title: From CLIP to DINO: Visual Encoders Shout in Multi-modal Large Language Models
item.description: By simply equipping it with an MLP layer for alignment, DINO surpasses CLIP in fine-grained related perception tasks.

item.title: METRA: Scalable Unsupervised RL with Metric-Aware Abstraction
item.description: Through our experiments in five locomotion and manipulation environments, we demonstrate that METRA can discover a variety of useful behaviors even in complex, pixel-based environments, being the first unsupervised RL method that discovers diverse locomotion behaviors in pixel-based Quadruped and Humanoid.

item.title: Welfare Diplomacy: Benchmarking Language Model Cooperation
item.description: The growing capabilities and increasingly widespread deployment of AI systems necessitate robust benchmarks for measuring their cooperative capabilities.

item.title: Fast Screening Rules for Optimal Design via Quadratic Lasso Reformulation
item.description: The problems of Lasso regression and optimal design of experiments share a critical property: their optimal solutions are typically \emph{sparse}, i. e., only a small fraction of the optimal variables are non-zero.

item.title: SiamAF: Learning Shared Information from ECG and PPG Signals for Robust Atrial Fibrillation Detection
item.description: Previous deep learning models learn from a single modality, either electrocardiogram (ECG) or photoplethysmography (PPG) signals.

item.title: HierarchicalContrast: A Coarse-to-Fine Contrastive Learning Framework for Cross-Domain Zero-Shot Slot Filling
item.description: To alleviate this issue, we present a novel Hierarchical Contrastive Learning Framework (HiCL) for zero-shot slot filling.

item.title: UniParser: Multi-Human Parsing with Unified Correlation Representation Learning
item.description: Multi-human parsing is an image segmentation task necessitating both instance-level and fine-grained category-level information.

item.title: Guiding AMR Parsing with Reverse Graph Linearization
item.description: Abstract Meaning Representation (AMR) parsing aims to extract an abstract semantic graph from a given sentence.

item.title: Explore-Instruct: Enhancing Domain-Specific Instruction Coverage through Active Exploration
item.description: Instruction-tuning can be substantially optimized through enhanced diversity, resulting in models capable of handling a broader spectrum of tasks.

item.title: Human-in-the-loop Machine Translation with Large Language Model
item.description: The large language model (LLM) has garnered significant attention due to its in-context learning mechanisms and emergent capabilities.

item.title: SeqXGPT: Sentence-Level AI-Generated Text Detection
item.description: Therefore, it is important to build strong AI-generated text (AIGT) detectors.

item.title: BibRank: Automatic Keyphrase Extraction Platform Using~Metadata
item.description: Automatic Keyphrase Extraction involves identifying essential phrases in a document.

item.title: xDial-Eval: A Multilingual Open-Domain Dialogue Evaluation Benchmark
item.description: The English dialogue data are extended to nine other languages with commercial machine translation systems.

item.title: Subspace Adaptation Prior for Few-Shot Learning
item.description: Gradient-based meta-learning techniques aim to distill useful prior knowledge from a set of training tasks such that new tasks can be learned more efficiently with gradient descent.

item.title: ChatKBQA: A Generate-then-Retrieve Framework for Knowledge Base Question Answering with Fine-tuned Large Language Models
item.description: Knowledge Base Question Answering (KBQA) aims to derive answers to natural language questions over large-scale knowledge bases (KBs), which are generally divided into two research components: knowledge retrieval and semantic parsing.

item.title: Textual Analysis of ICALEPCS and IPAC Conference Proceedings: Revealing Research Trends, Topics, and Collaborations for Future Insights and Advanced Search
item.description: In this paper, we show a textual analysis of past ICALEPCS and IPAC conference proceedings to gain insights into the research trends and topics discussed in the field.

item.title: Towards Example-Based NMT with Multi-Levenshtein Transformers
item.description: Retrieval-Augmented Machine Translation (RAMT) is attracting growing attention.

item.title: Relation-aware Ensemble Learning for Knowledge Graph Embedding
item.description: Knowledge graph (KG) embedding is a fundamental task in natural language processing, and various methods have been proposed to explore semantic patterns in distinctive ways.

item.title: A Framework for Few-Shot Policy Transfer through Observation Mapping and Behavior Cloning
item.description: We use Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) along with a cycle-consistency loss to map the observations between the source and target domains and later use this learned mapping to clone the successful source task behavior policy to the target domain.

item.title: Selectivity Drives Productivity: Efficient Dataset Pruning for Enhanced Transfer Learning
item.description: In this work, we aim to address the problem of DP for transfer learning, i. e., how to prune a source dataset for improved pretraining efficiency and lossless finetuning accuracy on downstream target tasks.

item.title: Making Multimodal Generation Easier: When Diffusion Models Meet LLMs
item.description: We present EasyGen, an efficient model designed to enhance multimodal understanding and generation by harnessing the capabilities of diffusion models and large language models (LLMs).

item.title: Hypernymy Understanding Evaluation of Text-to-Image Models via WordNet Hierarchy
item.description: Text-to-image synthesis has recently attracted widespread attention due to rapidly improving quality and numerous practical applications.

item.title: KCTS: Knowledge-Constrained Tree Search Decoding with Token-Level Hallucination Detection
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable human-level natural language generation capabilities.

item.title: Faster 3D cardiac CT segmentation with Vision Transformers
item.description: Accurate segmentation of the heart is essential for personalized blood flow simulations and surgical intervention planning.

item.title: Retrieval-Generation Alignment for End-to-End Task-Oriented Dialogue System
item.description: The results demonstrate that when combined with meta knowledge, the response generator can effectively leverage high-quality knowledge records from the retriever and enhance the quality of generated responses.

item.title: PerturbScore: Connecting Discrete and Continuous Perturbations in NLP
item.description: Through experimental results, we find that we can build a connection between discrete and continuous perturbations and use the proposed PerturbScore to learn such correlation, surpassing previous methods used in discrete perturbation measuring.

item.title: TIDE: Temporally Incremental Disparity Estimation via Pattern Flow in Structured Light System
item.description: Different from most former disparity estimation methods that operate in a frame-wise manner, our network acquires disparity maps in a temporally incremental way.

item.title: pose-format: Library for Viewing, Augmenting, and Handling .pose Files
item.description: The library includes a specialized file format that encapsulates various types of pose data, accommodating multiple individuals and an indefinite number of time frames, thus proving its utility for both image and video data.

item.title: DUSA: Decoupled Unsupervised Sim2Real Adaptation for Vehicle-to-Everything Collaborative Perception
item.description: To take full advantage of simulated data, we present a new unsupervised sim2real domain adaptation method for V2X collaborative detection named Decoupled Unsupervised Sim2Real Adaptation (DUSA).

item.title: UniPose: Detecting Any Keypoints
item.description: This work proposes a unified framework called UniPose to detect keypoints of any articulated (e. g., human and animal), rigid, and soft objects via visual or textual prompts for fine-grained vision understanding and manipulation.

item.title: An adaptive ensemble filter for heavy-tailed distributions: tuning-free inflation and localization
item.description: In these settings, the Kalman filter and its ensemble version - the ensemble Kalman filter (EnKF) - that have been designed under Gaussian assumptions result in degraded performance.

item.title: LightZero: A Unified Benchmark for Monte Carlo Tree Search in General Sequential Decision Scenarios
item.description: Building agents based on tree-search planning capabilities with learned models has achieved remarkable success in classic decision-making problems, such as Go and Atari.

item.title: Designing Observables for Measurements with Deep Learning
item.description: Many analyses in particle and nuclear physics use simulations to infer fundamental, effective, or phenomenological parameters of the underlying physics models.

item.title: Counting and Algorithmic Generalization with Transformers
item.description: Algorithmic generalization in machine learning refers to the ability to learn the underlying algorithm that generates data in a way that generalizes out-of-distribution.

item.title: Provably Robust Cost-Sensitive Learning via Randomized Smoothing
item.description: We focus on learning adversarially robust classifiers under a cost-sensitive scenario, where the potential harm of different classwise adversarial transformations is encoded in a binary cost matrix.

item.title: GDL-DS: A Benchmark for Geometric Deep Learning under Distribution Shifts
item.description: Geometric deep learning (GDL) has gained significant attention in various scientific fields, chiefly for its proficiency in modeling data with intricate geometric structures.

item.title: Virtual Augmented Reality for Atari Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In current Atari video game RL research, RL agents' perceptions of its environment is based on raw pixel data from the Atari video game screen with minimal image preprocessing.

item.title: DeltaSpace: A Semantic-aligned Feature Space for Flexible Text-guided Image Editing
item.description: Based on DeltaSpace, we propose a novel framework called DeltaEdit, which maps the CLIP visual feature differences to the latent space directions of a generative model during the training phase, and predicts the latent space directions from the CLIP textual feature differences during the inference phase.

item.title: Learning RL-Policies for Joint Beamforming Without Exploration: A Batch Constrained Off-Policy Approach
item.description: In this project, we consider the problem of network parameter optimization for rate maximization.
